p: Viral isolation was attempted by inoculating 200 μl of acute sera in 12.5 cm 2 plastic tissue culture flasks of Vero ( Cercopithecus aethiops kidney normal cells, ATCC® CCL-81™) and C6/36 ( Aedes albopictus cells, ATCC CRL-1660) were obtained from ATCC. After absorption for 2 hours at 28°C (C6/36) or 37°C (Vero), 5 mL medium with 1% fetal bovine serum was added to each flask, and the cells were incubated at the respective temperatures and 5% CO 2 and observed daily for evidence of viral cytopathic effect (CPE). Samples were inoculated twice for CPE confirmation. When the CPE was evident, RNA was extracted and tested using Alphavirus genus-specific RT-PCR [ 19].
